speaker: THAISA
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Enter GOWER

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Thy oath remember; thou hast sworn to do't:

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: 'Tis but a blow, which never shall be known.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Thou canst not do a thing in the world so soon,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: To yield thee so much profit. Let not conscience,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Which is but cold, inflaming love i' thy bosom,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Inflame too nicely; nor let pity, which

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Even women have cast off, melt thee, but be

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: A soldier to thy purpose.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: I will do't; but yet she is a goodly creature.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: The fitter, then, the gods should have her. Here

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: she comes weeping for her only mistress' death.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Thou art resolved?

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: I am resolved.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Enter MARINA, with a basket of flowers

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: No, I will rob Tellus of her weed,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: To strew thy green with flowers: the yellows, blues,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The purple violets, and marigolds,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Shall as a carpet hang upon thy grave,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: While summer-days do last. Ay me! poor maid,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Born in a tempest, when my mother died,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: This world to me is like a lasting storm,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Whirring me from my friends.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: How now, Marina! why do you keep alone?

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: How chance my daughter is not with you? Do not

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Consume your blood with sorrowing: you have

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: A nurse of me. Lord, how your favour's changed

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: With this unprofitable woe!

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Come, give me your flowers, ere the sea mar it.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Walk with Leonine; the air is quick there,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: And it pierces and sharpens the stomach. Come,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Leonine, take her by the arm, walk with her.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: No, I pray you;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I'll not bereave you of your servant.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Come, come;

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: I love the king your father, and yourself,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: With more than foreign heart. We every day

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Expect him here: when he shall come and find

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Our paragon to all reports thus blasted,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: He will repent the breadth of his great voyage;

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Blame both my lord and me, that we have taken

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: No care to your best courses. Go, I pray you,

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Walk, and be cheerful once again; reserve

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: That excellent complexion, which did steal

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: The eyes of young and old. Care not for me

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: I can go home alone.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Well, I will go;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But yet I have no desire to it.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Come, come, I know 'tis good for you.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Walk half an hour, Leonine, at the least:

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Remember what I have said.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: I warrant you, madam.

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: I'll leave you, my sweet lady, for a while:

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: Pray, walk softly, do not heat your blood:

speaker: DIONYZA
text_entry: What! I must have a care of you.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My thanks, sweet madam.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Exit DIONYZA

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Is this wind westerly that blows?

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: South-west.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: When I was born, the wind was north.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Was't so?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My father, as nurse said, did never fear,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But cried 'Good seaman!' to the sailors, galling

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: His kingly hands, haling ropes;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And, clasping to the mast, endured a sea

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That almost burst the deck.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: When was this?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: When I was born:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Never was waves nor wind more violent;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And from the ladder-tackle washes off

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: A canvas-climber. 'Ha!' says one, 'wilt out?'

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And with a dropping industry they skip

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: From stem to stern: the boatswain whistles, and

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The master calls, and trebles their confusion.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Come, say your prayers.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: What mean you?

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: If you require a little space for prayer,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: I grant it: pray; but be not tedious,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: For the gods are quick of ear, and I am sworn

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: To do my work with haste.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Why will you kill me?

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: To satisfy my lady.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Why would she have me kill'd?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Now, as I can remember, by my troth,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I never did her hurt in all my life:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I never spake bad word, nor did ill turn

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: To any living creature: believe me, la,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I never kill'd a mouse, nor hurt a fly:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I trod upon a worm against my will,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But I wept for it. How have I offended,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Wherein my death might yield her any profit,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Or my life imply her any danger?

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: My commission

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Is not to reason of the deed, but do it.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You will not do't for all the world, I hope.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You are well favour'd, and your looks foreshow

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You have a gentle heart. I saw you lately,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: When you caught hurt in parting two that fought:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Good sooth, it show'd well in you: do so now:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Your lady seeks my life; come you between,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And save poor me, the weaker.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: I am sworn,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: And will dispatch.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: He seizes her

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Enter Pirates

speaker: First Pirate
text_entry: Hold, villain!

speaker: First Pirate
text_entry: LEONINE runs away

speaker: Second Pirate
text_entry: A prize! a prize!

speaker: Third Pirate
text_entry: Half-part, mates, half-part.

speaker: Third Pirate
text_entry: Come, let's have her aboard suddenly.

speaker: Third Pirate
text_entry: Exeunt Pirates with MARINA

speaker: Third Pirate
text_entry: Re-enter LEONINE

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: These roguing thieves serve the great pirate Valdes;

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: And they have seized Marina. Let her go:

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: There's no hope she will return. I'll swear

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: she's dead,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: And thrown into the sea. But I'll see further:

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Perhaps they will but please themselves upon her,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Not carry her aboard. If she remain,

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Whom they have ravish'd must by me be slain.

speaker: LEONINE
text_entry: Exit
